content.question: The random variable <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a geometric distribution with <math alttext="p equals 0.25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Approximately how far do the values of <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> typically vary, on average, from the mean of the distribution?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
